title: Ridgefield’s acting superintendent approved by state
title_page: Ridgefield’s acting superintendent approved by state
maintext:
RIDGEFIELD — Robert Miller, who was appointed by the Board of Education last week, has been officially approved as acting superintendent for the district.
On March 12, the Board of Education voted to enter into a resignation agreement with Superintendent Karen Baldwin, who had been placed on administrative leave following claims she plagiarized documents and letters to parents.
The board then appointed Robert Miller, the director of operations development and technology, as the acting superintendent, pending approval from the state Department of Education. The state officially approved Miller’s appointment Monday, according to a release.
Miller will serve through June 30. He has worked as the director of operations development and technology with Ridgefield for the past three years and has nearly 19 years of experience working in technology with school districts.
